content: This is to be used as reference for flag,Disclaimer: Still a fan of Bitsler but I just do not agree with this, hopefully the wise community here can Support or Oppose.If you think this flag is without merit please feel free to oppose, otherwise your support will be appreciated.So I am a player of bitsler, I also contribute by reporting errors and typos, bugs(mostly just display ones), suggestions and recommendations.So last month I came to discover a presumably unintentional privacy violation of Bitsler, I told Gabriel(one of their admin) about it.Come today, I checked and the error is still happening. So with the help of a friend in what I should do, I decided to follow the procedure listed here:https://help.bitsler.com/hc/en-us/articles/360012865773-How-to-report-a-bug-Quote from: myself via emailHello,   This will serve as my formal application for the bounty you offer for finding error and/or bug.What I found was you're possible exposure to consequences for violation of privacy of users. Since you guys havethe feature where players can hide their username from the public list of bets, players would expect you to makesure their username is not seen by public in the "All Bets" list. For most of the games, it is working just fine,except for Blast.Attached here is a youtube link for a video of me making a bet in blast after making sure I opted-in hiding my username from the publicbets list. (snipped youtube link. ..)They have promptly replied, summary : I asked for the reward, BTC to be sent to my Wallet they refused. Gave me a gold chest instead which in my own experience of opening VipChests would be $2.50 worth of whatever currency it will draw, so I said I'd rather have the promised BTC as wisely advised by a friend.They declined, and I disagree with them in this matter so I seek your wise and fair opinion. If I am at wrong here, let me know. Thank you very dearly.link of the flag = https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;flag=3002edit:They casually made an agreement via :https://web.archive.org/web/diff/20210411153548/20220707091203/https://help.bitsler.com/hc/en-us/articles/360012865773-How-to-report-a-bug-

You can't do anything there.Next in your case, they are already covered by the possibility of a case like yours. They will be paid in BTC, only if you first one who's reported the same bug.https://help.bitsler.com/hc/en-us/articles/360012865773-How-to-report-a-bug-QuoteRewards may vary depending on the bug, and they will be given in BTC if you are the first one to find it on our website. it also seems that they already know about that bug, therefore, you are not the first to inform them about him. if they already knew about him and didn't bother to fix it, I believe that this bug is not that important to them. (Less reward for reporting it)what I like least about the whole thing, is in one part of the conversation, you seem like you are begging for BTC. I mean, you talk about the giveaway without clearly indicating value, but you still need him, plus asking for a withdrawal fee. I'm not sure that the ultimate goal of any casino is for users to take gifts and giveaways with them. it is always part of the casino promotions, I don't know how you came to the conclusion that BTC should be sent directly to your wallet.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: @jamyr, I opposed the flag.  I don't think this justifies the flag at all.   The report page, to which you provided a link, makes a very vague statement about what the reward will be, and specifies that you must be the first to report it.Quote from: https://help.bitsler.com/hc/en-us/articles/360012865773-How-to-report-a-bug-Rewards may vary depending on the bug, and they will be given in BTC if you are the first one to find it on our website.In the email chain they claim their developers are already aware of the bug, and I don't have any reason to doubt them.  If you like the site, and want it persist, then reporting bugs shouldn't be dependent on being rewarded.  Reporting bug is noble thing to do, and offering a bounty is also a noble thing to do, but making a stink about what the reward is, or how it's delivered isn't a good look, in my opinion.
